item.title: Ready for Your Close-Up? Not If You’re the Wrong Race
item.description: Ethnic gatekeeping in the arts doesn’t remove barriers — it erects them.

item.title: Al Jazeera Remains a Leopard That Can’t Change Its Spots
item.description: Despite talk of moderation, the network has continued to broadcast a distortion of reality.

item.title: End Racial Gerrymandering
item.description: The Supreme Court has a golden opportunity in Louisiana v. Callais to end racial gerrymanders.

item.title: A Critic Takes the White House Tour
item.description: It’s the time when the White House is the People’s House and history is most palpable, thanks to Mrs. Kennedy. But, alas, the tours are now canceled t...

item.title: Small Business Needs Permanent Regulatory Relief, Too
item.description: Congress and President Trump must act quickly to give 32 million small businesses permanent relief from a painful and pointless government mandate.
